DOC.brief_summary: Patients with atopic dermatitis treated with conventional treatment plus Dialyzed Leukocyte Extracts (DLE-oral Transferon) as adjuvant, have better clinical outcome than patients treated only with conventional treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Dialyzed Leukocytes Extracts to Treat Paediatric Moderate Atopic Dermatitis
DOC.criteria: Atopic dermatitis diagnosis by Hanifin and Rajka classification Dermatitis severity: Moderate, according with SCORAD index. Patients without treatment of topical steroids or immunosuppressants in the last 3 weeks. Patients with "informed consent form" signed by both parents, or advisor. Patients 7 years old or older whom have signed the assent form Patient who were treated with topical, or systemic steroids and/or immunosuppressants and they cannot discontinue their treatment. Patients who lived far from the hospital and they could not go to the visits.
